page.title: 01PRUDHOE AREA
page.content: The majority of houses in Prudhoe are semi_detached. There are a few bungalows and terraced houses. The estates are mixtures of council and private homes. All the houses have gardens, most of which are large. Prudhoe is adequately equipped with buses and has five major services running every half hour. Three of these pass through the estates. Front Street is the main street running through Prudhoe, which is easily accessed from the estates in the town. Front Street has enough shops to cater for most needs. The land around Prudhoe is mostly grassland used for grazing. The grass is used for cattle, hay and silage. A lot of land is also used for arable crops, including barley and oilseed. One farm supplies plants to nurseries.
